intro: Rhododendron hancockii var. longisepalum, commonly known as the long-sepal rhododendron, is a rare and ornamental plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan, China. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to deep red. The plant features dense, dark green foliage and is typically found in high-altitude, humid environments. Its flowers are notable for their elongated, showy sepals, which give the variety its common name. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
